arm_group.description: Clinical diagnosis of Parkinson's disease (cases are diagnosed by the presence of at least three of the five following primary signs: rest tremor, bradykinesia, rigidity, impaired postural refluxes, and the presence of a sustained L-dopa response.)

biospec_descr.textblock: Collect 10 mL peripheric blood for DNA extraction

brief_summary.textblock:
To observe and analyze the correlation between Single Nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) and
      the incidence of Parkinson's disease in Taiwanese.

clinical_study.brief_title: Genetic Polymorphism and Parkinson's Disease in Taiwanese

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Clinical diagnosis of Parkinson's disease (case subjects are diagnosed by the
             presence of at least three of the five following primary signs: rest tremor,
             bradykinesia, rigidity, impaired postural refluxes, and the presence of a sustained
             L-dopa response.)

          -  Healthy volunteers without Parkinson's disease

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Cases showing atypical features, including multiple system atrophy and progressive
             supranuclear gaze palsy, or secondary causes of Parkinsonism, such as neuroleptic
             drugs, infection, tumor, previous cerebrovascular accident and known toxins

facility.name: Department of Neurology, Chang-Hua Christian Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Association Analysis of Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms and the Incidence of Parkinson's Disease in a Hospital-based Case-control Study in Taiwan

primary_outcome.measure: single nucleotide polymorphisms in certain candidate genes

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
